entities.name: phoenix
entities.description: The phoenix is described as singing in a unique way that Harry has never heard before. The music is compared to a 'stricken lament of terrible beauty'. This suggests that the phoenix's song is a powerful and emotional expression.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is described as feeling a connection to the phoenix's song. He believes that the music is inside him, not outside, and that it is his own grief turned into song.

entities.name: molly
entities.description: Molly is mentioned as being on her way to the hospital with Arthur.

entities.name: arthur
entities.description: Arthur is mentioned as being on his way to the hospital with Molly.

relationships.description: Harry feels a connection to the phoenix's song, believing that it is inside him and a reflection of his own grief.
Molly and Arthur are mentioned as being on their way to the hospital together.
